TI CORRELATION BETWEEN THE ORTHO-POSITRONIUM PICK-OFF ANNIHILATION LIFETIME
   AND THE FREE-VOLUME IN MOLECULAR LIQUIDS AND POLYMERS
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID POLYATOMIC LIQUIDS; TRACER DIFFUSION
AB A good correlation between the ortho-positronium (omicron-Ps) pick-off annihilation lifetime and the free volume, computed as the difference between the specific volume at room temperature and that at 0 K, is reported for molecular liquids and polymers.  Bondi's group contribution approach was employed for estimating the specific volume at 0 K.  The omicron-Ps lifetimes in molecular solids, such as phenanthrene deviate considerably from the correlation.  It is suggested that a bubble may be formed around Ps in liquids and polymers, but not in the low-molecular-weight crystalline solids.  A correlation is presented between the diffusion coefficients of Ar and the lifetimes of omicron-Ps in both liquids and polymers.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF FAST AND FINE POSITION CONTROL-SYSTEM OF AN ULTRASONIC
   MOTOR
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 12TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS
CY DEC 02-04, 1991
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
DE ULTRASONIC MOTOR; FINE POSITIONING; FAST POSITIONING; PHASE SHIFT;
   LINEARIZATION; FEEDBACK CONTROL SYSTEM; INTEGRAL CONTROL ACTION
AB This paper shows experimentally that an ultrasonic motor has an approximate first-order transfer function between phase shift input and rotational speed output. A position control system which feedbacks position and velocity involving integral control action was developed. A fast response of about 100 msec and fairly high positioning accuracy up to a rotary encoder resolution were both realized in this system.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF POWERFUL AIRBORNE ULTRASONIC TRANSMITTER FOR ROBOT
   METROLOGY
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 12TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS
CY DEC 02-04, 1991
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
DE AIRBORNE ULTRASONIC TRANSMITTER; ELECTRIC SPARK; ROBOT METROLOGY;
   ULTRASONIC RANGING SYSTEM; 3-D MEASUREMENT; TRIANGULATION
AB An airborne ultrasonic transmitter which uses an electric spark discharge was developed for robot metrology. By inserting a condenser of a few hundred picofarads to the secondary side of an ignition coil in the electric circuit of the transmitter, the sound pressure of the radiated ultrasonic pulse becomes about ten times as strong as the case in which the condenser is not inserted. An ultrasonic ranging system which uses this transmitter was also developed.

TI SORPTION, DILATION, AND ISOTHERMAL GLASS-TRANSITION OF POLY(ETHYL
   METHACRYLATE)-ORGANIC GAS SYSTEMS
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE POLY(ETHYL METHACRYLATE); ETHYLENE; ETHANE; PROPANE; SORPTION; DILATION;
   ISOTHERMAL GLASS TRANSITION; PLASTICIZATION; DUAL-MODE SORPTION MODEL
ID PRESSURE CARBON-DIOXIDE; PARTIAL MOLAR VOLUME; POLYVINYL BENZOATE);
   POLYMERS
AB Sorption of ethylene, ethane, and propane into poly(ethyl methacrylate) and the concomitant dilation of the polymer are measured at 15-degrees-C.  Each sorption isotherm has a reverse-sigmoid shape described by the extended dual-mode sorption model, and dilation isotherms are similar in shape to the corresponding sorption isotherms.  Inflection on the isotherms is due to isothermal glass transition induced by the sorbed gases, whose concentration is the glass transition concentration C(g).  The C(g) value for propane is in accord with concentration at an abrupt change found on a curve of the concentration dependence of diffusivity.  Partial molar volumes of the gases at rubbery state and glassy state are evaluated from sorptive dilation data above and below C(g), respectively.  A correlation between plasticizing ability and partial molar volume for the gases is discussed.
RP KAMIYA, Y (reprint author), IND PROD RES INST,1-1-4 HIGASHI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
CR BONDI A, 1964, J PHYS CHEM-US, V68, P441, DOI 10.1021/j100785a001
   BOURBON D, 1990, J POLYM SCI POL PHYS, V28, P2057, DOI 10.1002/polb.1990.090281112

   CHIOU JS, 1986, J APPL POLYM SCI, V32, P2897, DOI 10.1002/app.1986.070320106

TI EXPERIMENT ON DIRECT IRRADIATION OF A BERYLLIUM WINDOW BY UNDULATOR
   RADIATION
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SYNCHROTRON RADIATION INSTRUMENTATION
CY JUL 15-19, 1991
CL CHESTER, ENGLAND
SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL, EUROPEAN ECON COMMUNITY, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT FACIL, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT SOC, NETHERLANDS ORG SCI RES, DARESBURY RES SERV, ICI, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, RANK XEROX, CARL ZEISS
ID HIGH-ENERGY-RESOLUTION; SYNCHROTRON RADIATION; WIGGLER BEAMLINE;
   SPECTROSCOPY; POWER
AB Beryllium windows were tested as the first target in a project for experimental simulations of heat load effects on beamline optical elements under direct irradiation of undulator and wiggler radiation.  Maximum temperature at the window center, vertical temperature distribution, and cooling capability by thermal conduction were studied.  It turned out that thermomechanical failure occurred when the temperature difference between the window center and its peripheral edges exceeded about 200-degrees-C.  This fact was in good agreement with a simple maximum-shearing-stress theory of the failure condition.

TI DIURNAL DEVIATION OF THE ORBIT CIRCUMFERENCE DUE TO BUILDING DISTORTION
SO REVIEW OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SYNCHROTRON RADIATION INSTRUMENTATION
CY JUL 15-19, 1991
CL CHESTER, ENGLAND
SP SCI & ENGN RES COUNCIL, EUROPEAN ECON COMMUNITY, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT FACIL, EUROPEAN SYNCHROTRON RADIAT SOC, NETHERLANDS ORG SCI RES, DARESBURY RES SERV, ICI, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, RANK XEROX, CARL ZEISS
AB Beam position stability was found to be largely affected by the distortion of the storage ring building, especially when the beam emittance was lowered.  Building distortion in the horizontal direction was noticed as the diurnal deviation of the orbit circumference.  The deviation was measured by reading the amount of rf frequency variation necessary to recover the horizontal central orbit.  The deviation of the orbit circumference was interpreted to be induced from the ring floor expansion.  Such diurnal expansion of the ring floor was evaluated by using a model simulation that dealt with the distortion of the ring building under thermal stress.  To reduce such thermal stress, the rooftop of the building was insulated.  The deviation of the ring circumference measured after insulation was reduced to one-half of that measured before.  The simulation also gave the same amount of deviations as measured before and after insulation.

TI FIBEROPTIC MICROWAVE TRANSMISSION USING HARMONIC LASER MIXING,
   OPTOELECTRONIC MIXING, AND OPTICALLY PUMPED MIXING
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MICROWAVE THEORY AND TECHNIQUES
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL MICROWAVE SYMP
CY JUN 10-14, 1991
CL BOSTON, MA
SP IEEE, MICROWAVE THEORY & TECH SOC
ID INJECTION-LOCKING; OSCILLATORS; HETERODYNE; DISTORTION
AB This paper proposes three fiber-optic link configurations for use in microwave and millimeter-wave signal transmission.  Harmonic laser mixing, optoelectronic mixing and optically pumped mixing are successfully utilized to achieve high carrier frequencies in fiber-optic links.  The performance of harmonic laser diode mixers is experimentally investigated in the X band.  The p-i-n photodiode is used as an optoelectronic microwave mixer and an optically pumped microwave mixer, and the microwave characteristics of these mixers are demonstrated.  These three fiber-optic link configurations show promise in transmitting microwave and millimeter-wave frequencies.

TI ISOTOPE AND TEMPERATURE EFFECTS ON THE REACTION OF PROTON-TRANSFER TO
   BENZENE ANIONS IN ETHANOL AT VERY LOW-TEMPERATURES - A TUNNELING
   REACTION
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY
LA English
DT Article
ID ELECTRON; ALCOHOLS
AB Isotope and temperature effects on the reaction of proton transfer from ethanol to the benzene anion (C6H6- + C2H5OH --> C6H7 + C2H5O-) has been studied by pulse radiolysis of an ethanol-benzene (5 mol %) mixture at 20-120 K and by ESR measurements after gamma-radiolysis.  When the C2H5OH-C6H6 mixture is irradiated by an electron pulse at 120 or 77 K, a sharp absorption spectrum of cyclohexadienyl (C6H7) radicals is observed at 315 nm after the pulse irradiation.  The yields of the C6H7 radicals decrease gradually with decreasing temperature.  The sharp band at 315 nm is scarcely observed at 20 K, while a broad band of benzene anions appears around 300 nm.  When a C2D5OD (or C2H5OD)-C6H6 (5 mol %) mixture is irradiated by an electron pulse, cyclohexadienyl (C6H6D) radicals are scarcely produced at 77 K within 100-mu-s after the irradiation, while the radicals are produced remarkably at 120 K by the reaction C6H6- + C2D5OD --> C6H6D + C2D2O-.  Since C6H6D radicals are observed by ESR about 30 min after gamma-irradiation of the C2D5OD-C6H6 mixture at 77 K, the deuteron-transfer reaction takes place slowly at 77 K.  The isotope effect (k(H)/k(D)) on the proton-transfer (or deuteron-transfer) reactions at 77 K exceeds 100.  Such a large isotope effect was interpreted in terms of a tunneling effect on the reactions.
RP MIYAZAKI, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM,FURO CHO,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI SELECTIVE SORPTION AND FACILITATED TRANSPORT OF OXYGEN IN
   PORPHINATOCOBALT-COORDINATED POLYMER MEMBRANES
SO MACROMOLECULES
LA English
DT Article
ID COBALT PORPHYRIN COMPLEX; DUAL-MODE TRANSPORT; MOLECULAR-OXYGEN;
   GLASSY-POLYMERS; FIXED CARRIER; MATRIX; GASES
AB Selective sorption and permeation of molecular oxygen are described for meso-alpha,alpha,alpha,alpha-tetrakis(o-pivalamidophenyl)porphinatocobalt(II) (CoP) coordinated polymer membranes (Chart I).  Oxygen solubility is ca. 70 times augmented in comparison with that of nitrogen by the CoP loading in the membrane.  Sorption isotherms of oxygen for the membranes are analyzed with a dual-mode sorption model to give C(c)' and K.  C(c)' (the saturated amount of oxygen reversibly bound to the CoP sorption site) is independent of temperature and increases with the loaded CoP amount into the membrane.  K (the oxygen-affinity constant of CoP) agrees with that determined spectroscopically by monitoring the CoP moiety in the membrane.  Oxygen permeation through the membrane is facilitated, and the permeability is in accordance with a dual-mode transport model.  Substituting the sorption parameters, C(c)' and K, in the model yields diffusion constants of oxygen in the membranes.
C1 WASEDA UNIV,DEPT POLYMER CHEM,TOKYO 169,JAPAN.

TI LARGE ENHANCEMENT OF SPIN POLARIZATION OBSERVED BY PHOTOELECTRONS FROM A
   STRAINED GAAS LAYER
SO PHYSICS LETTERS A
LA English
DT Article
AB We have observed a large enhancement of the spin polarization of photoelectrons emmitted from a 0.08-mu-m thick strained GaAs(001) layer grown on a GaPxAs1-x substrate by the MOCVD method with x = 0.17.  For this fraction of phosphorus, the lattice-mismatch was estimated to be approximately 0.6% and the energy splitting between heavy-hole and light-hole bands at the valence band maximum to be approximately 40 meV.  The maximum polarization of approximately 86% was observed with a quantum efficiency of approximately 2 x 10(-4), under the conditions that the cathode was at room temperature and the excitation photon wavelength was lambda almost-equal-to 860 nm.

   HIROSE, T
TI GAS-TRANSPORT IN POLY[BIS(TRIFLUOROETHOXY)PHOSPHAZENE] ABOVE THE T(1)
   TRANSITION
SO JOURNAL OF POLYMER SCIENCE PART B-POLYMER PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID PERMEATION PROPERTIES; POLYPHOSPHAZENES; POLYMERS; BEHAVIOR; MEMBRANE
AB Gas permeation measurements were performed by the time-lag method for 13 gases in poly[bis(trifluoroethoxy)phosphazene] above the mesophase transition, T(1) transition, of the crystals.  Hysteresis was found in the temperature dependence of the permeability coefficients for CO2, O2, and N2 in the transition region as observed by dilatometry and differential scanning calorimetry.  Independently the solubility of CO2 was determined gravimetrically above and below T(1).  Noticeable change and hysteresis were also observed in the temperature dependence of the solubility coefficients.  Diffusion of CO2 in the mesophase is suggested from the permeation and sorption measurements.  Gas transport parameters of CO2 in the mesophase are estimated, and the contributions of the mesophase and the crystalline phase to gas transport are considered.
RP MIZOGUCHI, K (reprint author), IND PROD RES INST,1-1-4 HIGASHI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI THE EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON GAS PERMEATION THROUGH SEMICRYSTALLINE
   POLYMERS ABOVE THE GLASS-TRANSITION TEMPERATURE
SO JOURNAL OF POLYMER SCIENCE PART B-POLYMER PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID FREE-VOLUME MODEL; CARBON-DIOXIDE; POLYETHYLENE; MEMBRANES; TRANSPORT;
   DIFFUSION; SORPTION; DILATION; TESTS
AB A method is proposed to analyze the effect of pressure on permeation of gases through semicrystalline polymers above the glass transition temperature.  The method utilizes similarities in molecular diameters of the gases and differences in their solubilities.  Two polymers, polyethylene and polypropylene, and a series of gases are chosen for an application of the method, and the effect of pressure on the permeabilities for 10 gases is measured in the pressure range 1-30 atm at 25-degrees-C.  For polymers, the logarithm of the permeability coefficient is linear in the pressure for each gas, with negative slope for slightly soluble gases (He, Ne, H-2, N2, O2, and Ar) and positive slope for highly soluble gases (CH4, Kr, CO2, and N2O).  Analyzing these slopes by the method proposed permits contributions of hydrostatic pressure and concentration to the pressure dependence of permeation to be evaluated.  On the basis of the results, the mechanism of gas permeation in rubbery films under high pressures is discussed.
RP NAITO, Y (reprint author), IND PROD RES INST,1-1-4 HIGASHI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI ARGON SORPTION AND PARTIAL MOLAR VOLUME IN POLY(ETHYL METHACRYLATE)
   ABOVE AND BELOW THE GLASS-TRANSITION TEMPERATURE
SO JOURNAL OF POLYMER SCIENCE PART B-POLYMER PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID CARBON-DIOXIDE; POLYVINYL BENZOATE); GAS SORPTION; CO2 SORPTION;
   DILATION; POLYCARBONATE; POLYMERS; POLY(ETHYLENE-TEREPHTHALATE); TG
AB Sorption and dilation isotherms for argon in poly(ethyl methacrylate) (PEMA) are reported for pressures up to 50 atm over the temperature range 5-85-degrees-C.  At temperatures below the glass transition (T(g) = 61-degrees-C), sorption isotherms are well described by the dual-mode sorption model; and isotherms above T(g) follow Henry's law.  However, isotherms for dilation due to sorption are linear in pressure at all temperatures over the range investigated.  Partial molar volumes of Ar in PEMA are obtained from these isotherms.  The volumes are approximately constant above T(g) (about 40 cm3/mol), whereas the volumes below T(g) are smaller and dependent on both temperature and concentration (19-26 cm3/mol).  By analyzing the experimental data according to the dual-mode sorption and dilation model, the volume occupied by a dissolved Ar molecule and the mean size of microvoid in the glass are estimated to be 67 and 129 angstrom 3, respectively.  The cohesive energy density of the polymer is also estimated as 61 cal/cm3 from the temperature dependence of the dual-mode parameters.
RP KAMIYA, Y (reprint author), IND PROD RES INST,1-1-4 HIGASHI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

   NIKI, E
TI LIQUID-PHASE AUTOXIDATION OF HEXANAL
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
ID OXIDATION
AB In order to obtain fundamental data on the oxidation of saturated aliphatic aldehydes in the liquid-phase, the effect of solvents was studied.  The oxidation reactions were performed at 0-degrees-C, 30-degrees-C and 40-degrees-C under atmospheric pressure of oxygen in varuous solvents in the presence or absence of radical initiator and cobalt catalyst.  The rates of oxidation differed by a factor of 2.7 with the structure of aldehydes and the rates in ethyl acetate were always a little higher than those in chlorobenzene.  Regardless of the kind of solvents or presence of catalyst, the initial rate of oxygen absorption was first order with respect to hexanal concentration.  Except for some solvents, the rates of oxidation was correlated with (D-1)/(2D + 1), where D is the dielectric constant of the solvent.  The ester solvents, especially ethyl acetate, gave faster rates and higher yields of peroxy acids than non-ester solvents.  The oxidation did not proceed in methanol even in the presence of metal catalyst.  The rate of oxidation increased with the yield of peroxy acid.  This indicates that the decomposition of peroxy acid affected the rate of oxidation.
RP YOSHIDA, Y (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC ENGN,DEPT REACT CHEM,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
CR BAWN CEH, 1951, T FARADAY SOC, V47, P721, DOI 10.1039/tf9514700721

TI EXISTENCE OF PORIFERASTEROL MONOGLUCOSIDE AND UDP-GLUCOSE -
   PORIFERASTEROL GLUCOSYLTRANSFERASE IN HAPLOID MYXOAMOEBAE OF MATING-LESS
   MUTANT, COLONIA STRAIN, OF PHYSARUM-POLYCEPHALUM
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE JAPAN ACADEMY SERIES B-PHYSICAL AND BIOLOGICAL
   SCIENCES
LA English
DT Article
DE PORIFERASTEROL MONOGLUCOSIDE; UDP-GLUCOSE; PORIFERASTEROL
   GLUCOSYLTRANSFERASE; MYXOAMOEBAE; (PHYSARUM-POLYCEPHALUM)
ID DIPLOID PLASMODIA; SLIME-MOLD; DIFFERENTIATION; AMEBAS; EXPRESSION
AB A sterol glucoside was detected in both myxoamoeboid and plasmodial stages of mating-less mutant, Colonia strain of Physarum polycephalum.  The isolated substance was characterized and identified as poriferasterol monoglucoside, which was recently detected in the plasmodia but not in the myxoamoebae of wild-type Physarum polycephalum.1)  The endogenous activity of UDP-glucose:  poriferasterol glucosyltransferase, which transfers glucose moiety from sugar nucleotide to poriferasterol and synthesizes poriferasterol monoglucoside, was found in both myxoamoebae and plasmodia of Colonia strain.  This enzyme as well as poriferasterol monoglucoside was detected in the wild-type plasmodia but not in the wild-type myxoamoebae.  In wild-type Physarum, the enzyme was expressed in the process of differentiation from myxoamoebae to plasmodia.2) To clarify the biological roles of poriferasterol monoglucoside in the membrane function, comparative studies of some physiological characteristics were performed.  The mutant myxoamoebae showed 5-times higher uptake of D-glucose than wild-type myxoamoebae.  Colonia myxoamoebae could grow in the glucose-based nutrient medium, but in this medium, wild-type myxoamoebae could hardly survive.
RP MURAKAMIMUROFUSHI, K (reprint author), OCHANOMIZU UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT BIOL,TOKYO 112,JAPAN.

TI SORPTION AND DILATION PROPERTIES OF POLY(PARA-PHENYLENE SULFIDE) UNDER
   HIGH-PRESSURE CARBON-DIOXIDE
SO JOURNAL OF POLYMER SCIENCE PART B-POLYMER PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
C1 IND PROD RES INST,1-1-4 HIGASHI,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
CR BARRER RM, 1958, J POLYM SCI, V27, P177, DOI 10.1002/pol.1958.1202711515
   Brady D. G., 1981, J APPL POLYM SCI APP, V36, P231
   BRADY DG, 1976, J APPL POLYM SCI, V20, P2541, DOI 10.1002/app.1976.070200921
